ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Van Allen Probe A Electric and Magnetic Field Instrument Suite and Integrated Science (EMFISIS) WaveForm Receiver (WFR) Three Axis Electric Field and Magnetic Field Continuous Burst Waveforms as 16384 Samples at 35 kS/sec, Level 2 (L2), 6 s Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, updated InformationURL URLs as needed, updated the SPDF MetadataContact Person to Robert M. Candey, metadata updated to SPASE 2.4.1, reviewed by LFB 20220818

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: Van Allen Probe A, Electric and Magnetic Field Instrument Suite and Integrated Science, EMFISIS, WaveForm Receiver, WFR, Level 2 Data. Three Axis Electric Field (Eu, Ev, Ew) and three Axis Magnetic Field (Bu, Bv, Bw) Continuous Burst Waveforms at 35 kS/s. The Continuous Waveform Burst Mode is very similar to the Waveform Burst with Spectral Matrices Mode in that it produces a standard Survey Set of Spectral Matrices based on a 0.5 s Waveform Capture every 6 s. In addition, this Mode captures Continuous Waveforms for 5.968 s between each 6 s Survey Data Set, leaving a 0.032 s Gap between successive Captures. This Mode can be operated continuously for fixed Durations up to several Minutes. Alternatively, it can be used in conjunction with Burst Quality Flags that retain the best N 5.968 s Captures (N â‰¤ 20) in a preset Time Interval. This Description is adapted from Kletzing et al., Space Sci. Rev. (2013) 179: 127-181, https://doi.org/10.1007/s11214-013-9993-6.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time
Parameter.Caveats: This Parameter exhibits an increasing Monotonic Progression.

Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH

Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ew Samples expressed as a Spectrogram versus Time Offsets

Parameter.Name: LWEzGainW Attenuator Select Indicator
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: LWEzGainW is the Attenuator Select Indicator for the W Axis, 0=Off
Parameter.Caveats: Attenuator Select Indicator for the W Axis: 0=Off, 1=On. Switches in a 19 dB Attenuator. Data at Level 2 and higher has the Attenuator Gains folded into the Data to provide correct Science Units.

Parameter.Name: LWExEyGainUV Attenuator Select Indicator
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: LWExEyGainUV is the Attenuator Select Indicator for the U and V Axes, 0=Off
Parameter.Caveats: Attenuator Select Indicator for the U and V Axes: 0=Off, 1=On. Switches in a 19 dB Attenuator. Data at Level 2 and higher has the Attenuator Gains folded into the Data to provide correct Science Units.

Parameter.Name: Search Coil Magnetometer Gain, SCMGain
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Search Coil Magnetometer Gain, SCMGain, Attenuator Select Indicator for Tri-Axial Magnetic Search Coil, MSC, Magnetometer, 0=Off
Parameter.Caveats: Attenuator Select Indicator for the MSC: 0=Off, 1=On. Switches in a 19 dB Attenuator. Data at Level 2 and higher has the Attenuator Gains folded into the Data to provide correct Science Units.

Parameter.Name: Sun Pulse Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time of Sun Pulse Time Tag
Parameter.Caveats: This Parameter exhibits an increasing Monotonic Progression.

Parameter.Name: Time Offsets
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Time Offsets

Parameter.Name: FFT Size
Parameter.Description: Size of the Fast Fourier Transform, FFT

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field, Bu, Power Spectra
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field, Bu, Power Spectra for the u-axis of the Spacecraft Science, UVW, Coordinate System
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function FFTPOWER with the following input parameters: BuSamples, fftSize.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field, Bv, Power Spectra
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field, Bv, Power Spectra for the v-axis of the Spacecraft Science, UVW, Coordinate System
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function FFTPOWER with the following input parameters: BvSamples, fftSize.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field, Bw, Power Spectra
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Magnetic Field, Bw, Power Spectra for the w-axis of the Spacecraft Science, UVW, Coordinate System
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function FFTPOWER with the following input parameters: BwSamples, fftSize.

Parameter.Name: Electric Field, Eu, Power Spectra
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Electric Field, Eu, Power Spectra for the u-axis of the Spacecraft Science, UVW, Coordinate System
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function FFTPOWER with the following input parameters: EuSamples, fftSize.

Parameter.Name: Electric Field, Ev, Power Spectra
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Electric Field, Ev, Power Spectra for the v-axis of the Spacecraft Science, UVW, Coordinate System
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function FFTPOWER with the following input parameters: EvSamples, fftSize.

Parameter.Name: Electric Field, Ew, Power Spectra

Parameter.Description: Electric Field, Ew, Power Spectra for the w-axis of the Spacecraft Science, UVW, Coordinate System
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function FFTPOWER with the following input parameters: EwSamples, fftSize.

Parameter.Name: Mission Elapsed Time, MET
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Mission Elapsed Time, MET

Parameter.Name: Application Identifier, APID
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Application Identifier, APID

Parameter.Name: B Calibration Coefficients
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: CALFREQUENCIES
Parameter.Description: The Magnetic Field Axes Calibration Coefficients are for all three Electric Field Axes Waveforms. The Coefficients are for Real and Imaginary Components and they should be applied in Frequency Space. Reference the Calibration Frequencies Variable, CalFrequency, for Center Band Frequency. The first Column contains Coefficients for the Real Component and the second Column contains Coefficients for the Imaginary Component.

Parameter.Name: E Calibration Coefficients
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: CALFREQUENCIES
Parameter.Description: The Electric Field Axes Calibration Coefficients are for all three Electric Field Axes Waveforms. The Coefficients are for Real and Imaginary Components and they should be applied in Frequency Space. Reference the Calibration Frequencies Variable, CalFrequency, for Center Band Frequency. The first Column contains Coefficients for the Real Component and the second Column contains Coefficients for the Imaginary Component.

Parameter.Name: Calibration Frequencies
Parameter.Description: Calibration Frequencies, to properly correct for Phase and Amplitude, the Calibrations should be applied in Frequency Space.

Parameter.Name: Wave Power Data Quality Flag
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: The Wave Power Data Quality Flag is calculated onboard. A Quality Factor is built by using one or more of the onboard Waves Space Weather Parameters to indicate Activity. The Space Weather Parameters reflect the Intensity in three Spectral Bands in both the Electric and Magnetic Channels of the Waves Instruments. These correspond approximately to the Lower Band Chorus and Upper Band Chorus, which are separated by one half of the Electron Cyclotron Frequency, and a low-frequency Band below the Lower Hybrid Frequency. The Wave Power Quality Flag can be used to capture the best Waveform Captures in a preset Time Interval.
